description.narrative: COVID19 pandemic and the subsequent lockdown has had con-siderable negative impact on workers in India's apparel <(>&<)> tex-tile industry. Studies by ILO and Apparel Export Promotion Council (AEPC, India) undertaken at the peak of the pandemic highlight a number of these impacts, including: wage cuts and delayed payments; job losses; reverse migration; closure of child-care facilities; suspension of statutory obligations such as contribution towards social security (ESI); higher risk of vio-lence and harassment against women and greater burden for care. Disruption in the global supply chain caused by COVID19 and the cascading effects of demand slowdown among brands/buyers brought the Indian apparel <(>&<)> textile industry to a near halt last year. As a result, more than 10 million people may have lost their jobs at the beginning of the government's stringent lockdown last year. The pandemic has also had a disproportionately negative im-pact on women workers, who constitute 80 per cent of total workforce. CRB proposes to develop and apply a self-assessment frame-work for Indian apparel <(>&<)> textile suppliers to help identify busi-ness and human rights risks in their supply chain and take pre-ventive measures in collaboration with other industry stake-holders to reduce possible adverse impacts from any future shocks and to comply with the growing expectations of buyers on business and human rights. The Government of India, through the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MoCA), has developed the national reporting and dis-closure framework (referred to as the Business Responsibility and Sustainability Reporting framework or BRSR ) based on the National Guidelines on Responsible Business Conduct (NGRBC) and is in the process of finalising India’s National Ac-tion Plan on Business and Human Rights (NAP). CRB will develop this framework aligning it with the NGRBC, reporting framework and the NAP and involving key industry stakeholder and voices from the ground. This framework would be made readily avail-able and accessible to suppliers/manufacturers through online and offline mediums.
